tools.name: Add file sharing preference
tools.description: Modifies sharing permissions for an existing Google Drive file, granting a specified role to a user, group, domain, or 'anyone'.

domain.description: Domain to grant permission to (e.g., 'example.com'). Required if 'type' is 'domain'.
domain.title: Domain

email_address.description: Email address of the user or group. Required if 'type' is 'user' or 'group'.
email_address.title: Email Address

file_id.description: Unique identifier of the file to update sharing settings for. Use GOOGLEDRIVE_FIND_FILE or GOOGLEDRIVE_LIST_FILES to get valid file IDs from your Google Drive.
file_id.title: File Id

role.description: Permission role to grant.
role.title: Role

transfer_ownership.description: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user. Required when role is 'owner'. Only a single user can be specified in the request when transferring ownership.
transfer_ownership.title: Transfer Ownership

type.description: Type of grantee for the permission.
type.title: Type

allowFileDiscovery.description: Indicates whether the item is discoverable through search. Applicable only for permissions of type "domain" or "anyone". For type="anyone", false indicates link-only access (not discoverable).
allowFileDiscovery.title: Allow File Discovery

deleted.description: Indicates whether the account associated with this permission has been deleted. Generally relevant for "user" or "group" permissions. Output only.
deleted.title: Deleted

displayName.description: The display name of the grantee. Typically present for user or group permissions.
displayName.title: Display Name

domain.description: The domain to which the permission applies. Present only when type is "domain".
domain.title: Domain

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group to which the permission applies. Present only for permissions of type 'user' or 'group'.
emailAddress.title: Email Address

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire, in RFC 3339 date-time format. After this time, the permission is removed.
expirationTime.title: Expiration Time

id.description: The unique identifier for the permission. For link-based sharing, this may be the literal "anyoneWithLink"; for user-based permissions, typically a numeric string.
id.title: Id

kind.description: Identifies the resource type; always "drive#permission".
kind.title: Kind

pendingOwner.description: Indicates whether the account associated with this permission is a pending owner on a file (not in a shared drive). Output only; relevant for permissions of type "user".
pendingOwner.title: Pending Owner

permissionDetails.description: Output only. Details of whether the permissions on this shared drive item are inherited or directly applied on this item. Present only for shared drive items.
permissionDetails.title: Permission Details

inheritedFrom.description: The ID of the item from which this permission is inherited.
inheritedFrom.title: Inherited From

permissionType.description: The type of permission on the item. 'file' indicates a permission that applies to the file; 'member' indicates a permission for the shared drive membership.
permissionType.title: Permission Type

role.description: The primary role for this user or group for this item. One of 'owner', 'organizer', 'fileOrganizer', 'writer', 'commenter', 'reader'.
role.title: Role

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available. Output only; typically present for permissions of type 'user'.
photoLink.title: Photo Link

role.description: The role granted by this permission which determines the level of access. "organizer" and "fileOrganizer" are applicable to shared drives.
role.title: Role

teamDrivePermissionDetails.description: Deprecated. Output only. Prior representation of permission details for Team Drives (now Shared drives). Use permissionDetails instead.
teamDrivePermissionDetails.title: Team Drive Permission Details

inherited.description: Deprecated. Whether the permission is inherited.
inherited.title: Inherited

inheritedFrom.description: Deprecated. The ID of the item from which this permission is inherited.
inheritedFrom.title: Inherited From

role.description: Deprecated. The role in the Team Drive context.
role.title: Role

teamDrivePermissionType.description: Deprecated. The type of permission in the Team Drive context. One of 'file' or 'member'.
teamDrivePermissionType.title: Team Drive Permission Type

type.description: The type of grantee to whom the permission applies. "user" indicates a specific user, "group" a Google Group, "domain" a Google Workspace domain, and "anyone" indicates link-based public access.
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Copy file
tools.description: Duplicates an existing file in Google Drive, identified by its `file_id`.

file_id.description: The unique identifier for the file on Google Drive that you want to copy. This ID can be retrieved from the file's shareable link or via other Google Drive API calls.
file_id.title: File Id

new_title.description: The title to assign to the new copy of the file. If not provided, the copied file will have the same title as the original, prefixed with 'Copy of '.

appProperties.description: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs private to the requesting app.
appProperties.title: App Properties

capabilities.description: Output only. Capabilities the current user has on this file.

tools.name: Create Shared Drive
tools.description: Tool to create a new shared drive. Use when you need to programmatically create a new shared drive for collaboration or storage.

backgroundImageFile.description: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this shared drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on drive.drives.update requests that don't set themeId. When specified, all fields of the backgroundImageFile must be set.
backgroundImageFile.title: BackgroundImageFile

id.description: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background.
id.title: Id

width.description: The width of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= width <= 1.0.
width.title: Width

xCoordinate.description: The X coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= xCoordinate <= 1.0.
xCoordinate.title: X Coordinate

yCoordinate.description: The Y coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= yCoordinate <= 1.0.
yCoordinate.title: Y Coordinate

colorRgb.description: The color of this shared drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.drives.update request that does not set themeId.
colorRgb.title: Color Rgb

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.
hidden.title: Hidden

name.description: The name of this shared drive.
name.title: Name

requestId.description: An ID, such as a random UUID, which uniquely identifies this user's request for idempotent creation of a shared drive. A repeated request by the same user and with the same request ID will avoid creating duplicates by attempting to create the same shared drive. If the shared drive already exists a 409 error will be returned.
requestId.title: Request Id

themeId.description: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible driveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.drives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.
themeId.title: Theme Id

backgroundImageFile.description: Specifies a custom background image file and optional cropping for the shared drive. Write-only in update requests; when setting a background you must not set themeId at the same time.
backgroundImageFile.title: BackgroundImageFile

id.description: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background.
id.title: Id

width.description: The width of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= width <= 1.0.
width.title: Width

xCoordinate.description: The X coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= xCoordinate <= 1.0.
xCoordinate.title: X Coordinate

yCoordinate.description: The Y coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= yCoordinate <= 1.0.
yCoordinate.title: Y Coordinate

backgroundImageLink.description: A short-lived link to this shared drive's background image. Present only if a background image is set. The URL may expire and should not be cached.
backgroundImageLink.title: Background Image Link

capabilities.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive. Each field indicates whether the user can perform the corresponding action.
capabilities.title: DriveCapabilities

canAddChildren.description: Whether the current user can add children (files or folders) to folders within this shared drive.
canAddChildren.title: Can Add Children

canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRes.description: Whether the current user can change the 'copyRequiresWriterPermission' restriction for this shared drive.
canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRes.title: Can Change Copy Requires Writer Permission Restriction

canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the current user can change the 'domainUsersOnly' restriction for this shared drive.
canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction.title: Can Change Domain Users Only Restriction

canChangeDriveBackground.description: Whether the current user can change the background of this shared drive (either theme or custom image).
canChangeDriveBackground.title: Can Change Drive Background

canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the current user can change the 'driveMembersOnly' restriction for this shared drive.
canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction.title: Can Change Drive Members Only Restriction

canChangeSharingFoldersRequiresOrganizer.description: Whether the current user can change the 'sharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermission' restriction for this shared drive.
canChangeSharingFoldersRequiresOrganizer.title: Can Change Sharing Folders Requires Organizer Permission Restriction

canComment.description: Whether the current user can comment on files in this shared drive.

canCopy.description: Whether the current user can copy files from this shared drive.
canCopy.title: Can Copy

canDeleteChildren.description: Whether the current user can delete children (files or folders) from folders in this shared drive.
canDeleteChildren.title: Can Delete Children

canDeleteDrive.description: Whether the current user can delete this shared drive.
canDeleteDrive.title: Can Delete Drive

canDownload.description: Whether the current user can download files from this shared drive.
canDownload.title: Can Download

canEdit.description: Whether the current user can edit files in this shared drive.
canEdit.title: Can Edit

canListChildren.description: Whether the current user can list the children of folders in this shared drive.
canListChildren.title: Can List Children

canManageMembers.description: Whether the current user can manage members of this shared drive.
canManageMembers.title: Can Manage Members

canReadRevisions.description: Whether the current user can read revisions of files in this shared drive.
canReadRevisions.title: Can Read Revisions

canRename.description: Whether the current user can rename files or folders within this shared drive.
canRename.title: Can Rename

canRenameDrive.description: Whether the current user can rename this shared drive.
canRenameDrive.title: Can Rename Drive

canResetDriveRestrictions.description: Whether the current user can reset all applied restrictions on this shared drive to their default values.

canShare.description: Whether the current user can share files or folders in this shared drive.

canTrashChildren.description: Whether the current user can move children (files or folders) to the trash within this shared drive.

orgUnitId.description: The organizational unit ID associated with this shared drive. Present only for shared drives within organizations that use organizational units.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.title: Copy Requires Writer Permission

themeId.description: The ID of the selected theme for this shared drive's background image and color. Cannot be used together with backgroundImageFile when setting a background.
themeId.title: Theme Id

error.title: Error

successful.title: Successful

Examples: Export a Google Doc to plain text: {"file_id": "1N2o5xQWmAbCdEfGhIJKlmnOPq", "mime_type": "text/plain"} Download a Google Sheet as CSV: {"file_id": "1ZyXwVuTsRqPoNmLkJiHgFeDcB", "mime_type": "text/csv"}

tools.name: Find file
tools.description: The comprehensive Google Drive search tool that handles all file and folder discovery needs. Use this for any file finding task - from simple name searches to complex queries with date filters, MIME types, permissions, custom properties, folder scoping, and more. Searches across My Drive and shared drives with full metadata support. Examples: - Find PDFs: q="mimeType = 'application/pdf'" - Find recent files: q="modifiedTime > '2024-01-01T00:00:00'" - Search by name: q="name contains 'report'" - Files in folder: folderId="abc123" or q="'FOLDER_ID' in parents"

corpora.description:
Specifies which collections of files to search. Defaults to 'allDrives' (searches My Drive + all accessible shared drives).

        **Values:**
        - `user` - Search only user's personal My Drive
        - `domain` - Search all files shared within Google Workspace domain
        - `drive` - Search specific shared drive (requires 'driveId' parameter and 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' must be true)
        - `allDrives` - Search My Drive + all accessible shared drives (DEFAULT, requires 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' to be true)

        **When to Use:**
        - Personal files only: Use 'user'
        - Organization-wide: Use 'domain'
        - Specific shared drive: Use 'drive' with 'driveId'
        - Maximum coverage: Use 'allDrives' (auto-enables supportsAllDrives and includeItemsFromAllDrives)
corpora.title: Corpora

driveId.description: ID of the shared drive to search. Required if 'corpora' is 'drive'.
driveId.title: Drive Id

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. Use '*' for all fields or a comma-separated list, e.g., 'nextPageToken,files(id,name,mimeType)'.
fields.title: Fields

folder_id.description: ID of a specific folder to search within. This automatically adds "'folder_id' in parents" to the query. Can be combined with the 'q' parameter to further filter results within the folder.
folder_id.title: Folder Id

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results. Must be true when corpora is 'drive' or 'allDrives'. If true, 'supportsAllDrives' should also be true.
includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives

include_labels.description: A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response for each file.
include_labels.title: Include Labels

include_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Currently, only 'published' is supported, which includes permissions for files with published content.
include_permissions_for_view.title: Include Permissions For View

orderBy.description:
Comma-separated sort keys. Ascending by default; add 'desc' for descending. Cannot be used when query (q) contains fullText search terms.

        **Valid Keys:**
        - `createdTime`, `modifiedTime`, `modifiedByMeTime` - Dates
        - `viewedByMeTime`, `sharedWithMeTime` - Activity dates
        - `name`, `name_natural` - File name (natural: file1, file2, file10)
        - `folder` - Folder hierarchy
        - `quotaBytesUsed` - Storage size
        - `starred`, `recency` - Starred status, recent activity
        
        **Restriction:** Sorting is not supported when the query contains fullText searches (e.g., "fullText contains 'keyword'"). Omit orderBy when using fullText queries.
orderBy.title: Order By

pageSize.description: The maximum number of files to return per page.
pageSize.title: Page Size

pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page.
pageToken.title: Page Token

q.description:
Query string to filter file results. Syntax: 'field operator value' combined with 'and', 'or', 'not'.

        **Operators:** =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, contains, in

        **Common Fields:**
        - `name`, `fullText` - File name or content
        - `mimeType` - File type (e.g., 'application/pdf', 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder')
        - `modifiedTime`, `createdTime` - Dates (RFC 3339: '2024-01-01T00:00:00')
        - `trashed`, `starred`, `sharedWithMe` - Boolean flags
        - `parents` - Folder IDs containing the file
        - `owners`, `writers` - User email addresses
        - `properties`, `appProperties` - Custom metadata

        **Special Syntax:**
        - Dates: RFC 3339 format (time zone defaults to UTC)
        - Escaping: Use backslash for special chars: "name contains 'owner\'s file'"
        - Grouping: Use parentheses for OR: "(mimeType contains 'image/' or mimeType contains 'video/')"
        - Custom properties: "properties has { key='department' and value='sales' }"
        
        **Common Use Cases:**
        - Find files modified after timestamp: "modifiedTime > '2024-10-01T14:30:00'"
        - Search file content: "fullText contains 'quarterly results'"
q.title: Q
examples: name contains 'report' and not name contains 'draft'
name contains 'invoice' and modifiedTime > '2024-01-01T00:00:00' and trashed = false

spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.
spaces.title: Spaces

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. If 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' is true, this must also be true.
supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives

files.description: The list of files. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.
files.title: Files

appProperties.description: A collection of custom key-value properties set by the application. Keys and values are strings private to the app.
appProperties.title: App Properties

capabilities.description: A set of capabilities that indicate the actions the authenticated user can perform on the file.
capabilities.title: GoogleDriveFileCapabilities

canAcceptOwnership.description: Whether the current user can accept ownership transfer for this file.
canAcceptOwnership.title: Can Accept Ownership

tools.name: Get Permission
tools.description: Gets a permission by ID. Use this tool to retrieve a specific permission for a file or shared drive.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. Use 'fields=*' to return all available fields for the permission resource.
fields.title: Fields

supports_all_drives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.
supports_all_drives.title: Supports All Drives

use_domain_admin_access.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if the file ID parameter refers to a shared drive and the requester is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.
use_domain_admin_access.title: Use Domain Admin Access

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search. This is only applicable for permissions of type domain or anyone.
allowFileDiscovery.title: Allow File Discovery

deleted.description: Whether the account associated with this permission has been deleted. This field only pertains to user and group permissions.
deleted.title: Deleted

displayName.description: A displayable name for users, groups or domains.
displayName.title: Display Name

domain.description: The domain to which this permission refers.
domain.title: Domain

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group to which this permission refers.
emailAddress.title: Email Address

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time). Expiration times have the following restrictions: - They can only be set on user and group permissions - The time must be in the future - The time cannot be more than a year in the future
expirationTime.title: Expiration Time

id.description: The ID of the permission. This is a unique identifier for the grantee, and is published in User resources as permissionId.
id.title: Id

inheritedPermissionsDisabled.description: If true, only organizers, file organizers, and owners of the item can share or access the item. Read-only. This field only applies to items in shared drives.
inheritedPermissionsDisabled.title: Inherited Permissions Disabled

kind.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#permission".
kind.title: Kind

pendingOwner.description: Whether the user is a pending owner of the file. This is only applicable for user permissions for files that are not in a shared drive.
pendingOwner.title: Pending Owner

permissionDetails.description: Output-only details about how the permission is applied for items in shared drives (formerly Team Drives). Indicates whether the permission is inherited or directly applied, and the effective roles. Present only for items in shared drives.
permissionDetails.title: Permission Details

additionalRoles.description: Additional roles for this user. Currently only 'commenter' is supported.
additionalRoles.title: Additional Roles

inherited.description: Whether this permission is inherited from a parent. Output only.
inherited.title: Inherited

inheritedFrom.description: The ID of the item from which this permission is inherited. Populated only when the permission is inherited.
inheritedFrom.title: Inherited From

permissionType.description: The type of permission this entry represents for the user. One of 'file' or 'member'.
permissionType.title: Permission Type

role.description: The primary role for this user as applied to the item.
role.title: Role

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available.
photoLink.title: Photo Link

role.description: The role granted by this permission. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently possible: "owner", "organizer", "fileOrganizer", "writer", "commenter", "reader"
role.title: Role

teamDrivePermissionDetails.description: Deprecated. Use permissionDetails instead. Historically provided details for items in Team Drives (now shared drives), indicating whether permissions were inherited or directly applied and the effective roles.
teamDrivePermissionDetails.title: Team Drive Permission Details

additionalRoles.description: Deprecated. Additional roles for this user in Team Drive (now shared drives). Currently only 'commenter' is supported.
additionalRoles.title: Additional Roles

type.description: The type of the grantee. Valid values are: "user", "group", "domain", "anyone"
type.title: Type

view.description: Indicates the view for this permission. Only populated for permissions that belong to a view. published is the only supported value.
view.title: View

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

permissionId.description: The user's permission ID, if available.

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available.

content.title: Content

createdTime.description: The time at which the reply was created (RFC 3339 format).
createdTime.title: Created Time

deleted.description: Whether the reply has been deleted. A deleted reply has no content.
deleted.title: Deleted

htmlContent.description: The content of the reply with HTML formatting. May be absent for deleted replies.
htmlContent.title: Html Content

id.description: The ID of the reply.
id.title: Id

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource; always "drive#reply".
kind.title: Kind

modifiedTime.description: The time at which the reply was last modified (RFC 3339 format).
modifiedTime.title: Modified Time

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.description: Tool to get a specific revision's metadata by revision ID. Use when you need to retrieve information about a particular version of a file.

exportLinks.description: A map of export formats to URLs for exporting the revision of a Docs Editors file. Keys are MIME types; values are URLs.

If not set, this revision may be automatically purged 30 days after newer content is uploaded. Applicable only to files with binary content in Drive. A maximum of 200 revisions per file can be kept forever.

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. For revisions, this is always 'drive#revision'.
kind.title: Kind

lastModifyingUser.description: Information about the last user who modified this revision.
lastModifyingUser.title: LastModifyingUser

displayName.description: A plain text displayable name for this user.
displayName.title: Display Name

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user. May not be present for all users.
emailAddress.title: Email Address

kind.description: Identifies the type of user resource. Always 'drive#user'.

me.description: Whether this user is the requesting user.
me.title: Me

permissionId.description: The permission ID for this user, suitable for use in the permissions API.
permissionId.title: Permission Id

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo.
photoLink.title: Photo Link

md5Checksum.description: The MD5 checksum of the revision's content. Applicable only to files with binary content in Drive.
md5Checksum.title: Md5 Checksum

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the revision.
mimeType.title: Mime Type

modifiedTime.description: The last time the revision was modified (RFC 3339 date-time).
modifiedTime.title: Modified Time

originalFilename.description: The original filename used to create this revision. Applicable only to files with binary content in Drive.
originalFilename.title: Original Filename

publishAuto.description: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. Applicable only to Docs Editors files.
publishAuto.title: Publish Auto

published.description: Whether this revision is published. Applicable only to Docs Editors files.
published.title: Published

publishedLink.description: A link to the published revision. Populated only for Google Sites files.
publishedLink.title: Published Link

publishedOutsideDomain.description: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. Applicable only to Docs Editors files.
publishedOutsideDomain.title: Published Outside Domain

size.description: The size of the revision's content in bytes. Returned as a string representing a 64-bit integer. Applicable only to files with binary content in Drive.
size.title: Size

error.title: Error

successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List Changes
tools.description: Tool to list the changes for a user or shared drive. Use when you need to track modifications to files and folders, such as creations, deletions, or permission changes. This action requires a `pageToken` which can be initially obtained using the `get_changes_start_page_token` action or from a previous `LIST_CHANGES` response. Example usage: ```json { "pageSize": 100, "includeRemoved": true } ``` Returns changes with timestamps, file IDs, and modification details. Save the `newStartPageToken` from the response to monitor future changes efficiently.

driveId.description: The shared drive from which changes will be returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the shared drive; use the combined drive ID and change ID as an identifier.
driveId.title: Drive Id

includeCorpusRemovals.description: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file.
includeCorpusRemovals.title: Include Corpus Removals

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.
includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives

includeLabels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response.
includeLabels.title: Include Labels

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.
includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View

includeRemoved.description: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.
includeRemoved.title: Include Removed

pageSize.description: The maximum number of changes to return per page.
pageSize.title: Page Size

pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.
pageToken.title: Page Token

restrictToMyDrive.description: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive.
restrictToMyDrive.title: Restrict To My Drive

spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpora. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.
spaces.title: Spaces

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.
supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives

changes.description: The list of changes. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.
changes.title: Changes

changeType.description: The type of the change. "file" indicates a file change; "drive" indicates a shared drive change.
changeType.title: Change Type

drive.description: The updated state of the shared drive. Present only if changeType is 'drive', the user is still a member of the shared drive, and the shared drive has not been deleted.
drive.title: Drive

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive associated with this change.
driveId.title: Drive Id

file.description: The updated state of the file. Present only if changeType is 'file' and the file has not been removed from this list of changes.
file.title: File

fileId.description: The ID of the file which has changed.
fileId.title: File Id

kind.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#change".
kind.title: Kind

removed.description: Whether the file or shared drive has been removed from this list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.
removed.title: Removed

time.description: The time of this change (RFC 3339 date-time).
time.title: Time

kind.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#changeList".
kind.title: Kind

newStartPageToken.description: The starting page token for future changes. This will be present only if the end of the current changes list has been reached. The page token doesn't expire.
newStartPageToken.title: New Start Page Token

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of changes. This will be absent if the end of the changes list has been reached. The page token doesn't expire.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

kind.description: Identifies the type of this resource. Always 'drive#user' for a User.

tools.name: List Files and Folders
tools.description: Tool to list a user's files and folders in Google Drive. Use this to search or browse for files and folders based on various criteria.

corpora.description: Specifies the bodies of items (files/documents) to which the query applies. Supported values are 'user', 'domain', 'drive', and 'allDrives'. It's generally more efficient to use 'user' or 'drive' instead of 'allDrives'. Defaults to 'user'.
corpora.title: Corpora

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive to search. This is used when `corpora` is set to 'drive'.
driveId.title: Drive Id

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. This can be used to retrieve only specific file metadata, improving performance. Example: 'nextPageToken, files(id, name, mimeType, modifiedTime)'
fields.title: Fields

folderId.description: ID of a specific folder to list files from. This is a convenience parameter that automatically adds "'folder_id' in parents" to the query. Cannot be used together with a custom 'q' parameter.
folderId.title: Folder Id

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether to include items from both My Drive and shared drives. This is relevant when `corpora` is 'user' or 'domain'. Defaults to false.
includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives

includeLabels.description: A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response for each file.
includeLabels.title: Include Labels

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Currently, only 'published' is supported, which includes permissions for files with published content.
includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View

orderBy.description: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys include 'createdTime', 'folder', 'modifiedByMeTime', 'modifiedTime', 'name', 'name_natural', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeTime', 'starred', 'viewedByMeTime'. Each key sorts in ascending order by default, but can be reversed with the 'desc' modifier (e.g., 'modifiedTime desc').
orderBy.title: Order By

pageSize.description: The maximum number of files to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 1000, inclusive. Defaults to 100.
pageSize.title: Page Size

pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.
pageToken.title: Page Token

q.description: A query string for filtering the file results. Supports operators like 'and', 'or', 'not', and can filter on fields like 'name', 'mimeType', 'modifiedTime', 'starred', 'trashed'. Example: "name contains 'important' and mimeType = 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'".
q.title: Q

spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpora. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'. 'drive' represents files in My Drive and shared drives, while 'appDataFolder' represents the application's private data folder.
spaces.title: Spaces

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to false. If true, then `includeItemsFromAllDrives` can be used to extend the search to all drives.
supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives

files.description: The list of files. Each item is a File resource. The fields included for each file depend on the 'fields' query parameter. May be empty if no items match.
files.title: Files

incompleteSearch.description: Whether the search process was incomplete. If true, then some search results may be missing.
incompleteSearch.title: Incomplete Search

kind.description: Identifies the resource type of the response. For files.list this is always 'drive#fileList'.
kind.title: Kind

nextPageToken.description: Token for continuing a truncated list request. Use this value in the 'pageToken' parameter of a subsequent request to retrieve the next page of results. Present only if there are more files to retrieve.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List Permissions
tools.description: Tool to list a file's permissions. Use when you need to retrieve all permissions associated with a specific file or shared drive.

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.
fileId.title: File Id

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.
includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View

pageSize.description: The maximum number of permissions to return per page. When not set for files in a shared drive, at most 100 results will be returned. When not set for files that are not in a shared drive, the entire list will be returned.
pageSize.title: Page Size

pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.
pageToken.title: Page Token

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Default: false
supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives

useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then theRequester will be granted access if the file ID parameter refers to a shared drive and the requester is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.
useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access

kind.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#permissionList".
kind.title: Kind

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of permissions. This will be absent if the end of the list has been reached.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

permissions.description: The list of permissions. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.
permissions.title: Permissions

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List Replies to Comment
tools.description: Tool to list replies to a comment in Google Drive. Use this when you need to retrieve all replies associated with a specific comment on a file.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. Use '*' for all fields or e.g. 'replies(id,content),nextPageToken'
fields.title: Fields

include_deleted.description: Whether to include deleted replies. Deleted replies will not include their original content.
include_deleted.title: Include Deleted

page_size.description: The maximum number of replies to return per page.
page_size.title: Page Size

page_token.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.
page_token.title: Page Token

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. Value: the fixed string "drive#replyList".
kind.title: Kind

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of replies. Absent if the end of the list has been reached.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

items.description:
A reply to a comment on a file.

Matches Google Drive API v3 Reply schema: https://developers.google.com/drive/api/reference/rest/v3/replies#Reply
items.title: Reply

action.description: The action the reply performed to the parent comment. Valid values are "resolve" and "reopen". May be unset when the reply is a standard text reply.
action.title: Action

author.description:
A user account in Drive.

Matches Google Drive API v3 User schema: https://developers.google.com/drive/api/reference/rest/v3/about#User
author.title: User

displayName.description: A plain text displayable name for this user.
displayName.title: Display Name

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user. May not be present depending on the user's settings and the requester's permissions.
emailAddress.title: Email Address

kind.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#user".
kind.title: Kind

me.description: Whether this user is the requesting user.
me.title: Me

permissionId.description: The user's ID as visible in Permission resources.
permissionId.title: Permission Id

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available.
photoLink.title: Photo Link

content.description: The plain text content of the reply. Not present for deleted replies.
content.title: Content

createdTime.description: The time at which the reply was created (RFC 3339 date-time).
createdTime.title: Created Time

deleted.description: Whether the reply has been deleted. A deleted reply has no content.
deleted.title: Deleted

htmlContent.description: The content of the reply with HTML formatting. Not present for deleted replies.
htmlContent.title: Html Content

id.description: The ID of the reply.
id.title: Id

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. Value: the fixed string "drive#reply".
kind.title: Kind

modifiedTime.description: The time at which the reply was last modified (RFC 3339 date-time).
modifiedTime.title: Modified Time

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List File Revisions
tools.description: Tool to list a file's revisions. Use when you need to retrieve the revision history of a specific file in Google Drive.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of revisions to return per page.
pageSize.title: Page Size

pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.
pageToken.title: Page Token

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to false.
supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives

kind.description: Identifies the type of this resource. Always 'drive#revisionList' for revisions list responses.
kind.title: Kind

nextPageToken.description: The token to continue a fragmented list request on the next page. Present only if more results are available.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs Editors files to specific formats. A map of MIME type to export URL. Present only for Google Docs Editors files.
exportLinks.title: Export Links

id.description: The ID of the revision. May be a numeric-like string or an opaque string.
id.title: Id

keepForever.description: Whether to keep this revision forever. Only applicable to files with content stored in Drive.
keepForever.title: Keep Forever

kind.description: Identifies the type of this resource. Always 'drive#revision' for revision resources.
kind.title: Kind

lastModifyingUser.description: Information about the user who last modified this revision.
lastModifyingUser.title: User

displayName.description: The user's display name.
displayName.title: Display Name

emailAddress.description: The user's email address.
emailAddress.title: Email Address

kind.description: Identifies the type of this resource. Always 'drive#user' for user resources.
kind.title: Kind

me.description: Whether this user is the requesting authenticated user.
me.title: Me

permissionId.description: The user's permission ID, which can be used with the Permissions API.
permissionId.title: Permission Id

photoLink.description: A link to the user's profile photo.
photoLink.title: Photo Link

md5Checksum.description: The MD5 checksum of the revision's content. Only applicable to files with binary content stored in Drive.
md5Checksum.title: Md5 Checksum

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the revision content or the Google Workspace document type.
mimeType.title: Mime Type

modifiedTime.description: The time at which this revision was last modified (RFC 3339 date-time, UTC).
modifiedTime.title: Modified Time

originalFilename.description: The original filename used to create this revision. Only applicable to files with binary content stored in Drive.
originalFilename.title: Original Filename

publishAuto.description: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. Applicable only to Google Docs Editors files.
publishAuto.title: Publish Auto

published.description: Whether this revision is published. Applicable only to Google Docs Editors files.
published.title: Published

publishedLink.description: A link to the published revision. Populated only for Google Sites files.
publishedLink.title: Published Link

publishedOutsideDomain.description: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. Applicable only to Google Docs Editors files.
publishedOutsideDomain.title: Published Outside Domain

size.description: The size of the revision's content in bytes, represented as a string. Only applicable to files with binary content stored in Drive.
size.title: Size

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List Shared Drives
tools.description: Tool to list the user's shared drives. Use when you need to get a list of all shared drives accessible to the authenticated user.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of shared drives to return per page.
pageSize.title: Page Size

q.description: Query string for searching shared drives.
q.title: Q

useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator. If set to true, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.
useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access

drives.description: List of shared drives visible to the caller. The array can be empty if no shared drives are available.
drives.title: Drives

backgroundImageLink.description: A short-lived link to the shared drives background image.
backgroundImageLink.title: Background Image Link

capabilities.description: A set of capability flags indicating the actions the current user can perform on the shared drive and its contents.
capabilities.title: DriveCapabilities

canAddChildren.description: Whether the user can add children to folders in the shared drive.
canAddChildren.title: Can Add Children

canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRes.description: Whether the user can change the 'copyRequiresWriterPermission' restriction of the shared drive.
canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRes.title: Can Change Copy Requires Writer Permission Restriction

canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the user can change the 'domainUsersOnly' restriction of the shared drive.
canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction.title: Can Change Domain Users Only Restriction

canChangeDriveBackground.description: Whether the user can change the background of the shared drive.
canChangeDriveBackground.title: Can Change Drive Background

canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the user can change the 'driveMembersOnly' restriction of the shared drive.
canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction.title: Can Change Drive Members Only Restriction

canChangeSharingFoldersRequiresOrganizer.description: Whether the user can change the 'sharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermission' restriction of the shared drive.
canChangeSharingFoldersRequiresOrganizer.title: Can Change Sharing Folders Requires Organizer Permission Restriction

canComment.description: Whether the user can comment on files in the shared drive.
canComment.title: Can Comment

canCopy.description: Whether the user can copy files in the shared drive.
canCopy.title: Can Copy

canDeleteChildren.description: Whether the user can delete children from folders in the shared drive.
canDeleteChildren.title: Can Delete Children

canDeleteDrive.description: Whether the user can delete the shared drive.
canDeleteDrive.title: Can Delete Drive

canDownload.description: Whether the user can download files in the shared drive.
canDownload.title: Can Download

canEdit.description: Whether the user can edit files in the shared drive.
canEdit.title: Can Edit

canListChildren.description: Whether the user can list the children of folders in the shared drive.
canListChildren.title: Can List Children

canManageMembers.description: Whether the user can manage members of the shared drive.
canManageMembers.title: Can Manage Members

canReadRevisions.description: Whether the user can read revisions of files in the shared drive.
canReadRevisions.title: Can Read Revisions

canRename.description: Whether the user can rename files or folders in the shared drive.
canRename.title: Can Rename

canRenameDrive.description: Whether the user can rename the shared drive.
canRenameDrive.title: Can Rename Drive

canResetDriveRestrictions.description: Whether the user can reset the shared drive restrictions to defaults.
canResetDriveRestrictions.title: Can Reset Drive Restrictions

canShare.description: Whether the user can share files or folders in the shared drive.
canShare.title: Can Share

canTrashChildren.description: Whether the user can move children to trash from folders in the shared drive.
canTrashChildren.title: Can Trash Children

colorRgb.description: The color of the shared drive as an RGB hex string (e.g., '#4285F4'). Can only be set on update requests that do not set 'themeId'.
colorRgb.title: Color Rgb

createdTime.description: The time at which the shared drive was created, in RFC 3339 date-time format.
createdTime.title: Created Time

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from the default view.
hidden.title: Hidden

id.description: The unique identifier of the shared drive.
id.title: Id

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. Always "drive#drive".
kind.title: Kind

name.description: The name of the shared drive.
name.title: Name

orgUnitId.description: Output-only, conditionally returned. The organizational unit ID associated with the shared drive. Populated only when 'useDomainAdminAccess=true' in the request.
orgUnitId.title: Org Unit Id

restrictions.description: Restrictions applied to the shared drive and/or its contents.
restrictions.title: DriveRestrictions

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on the shared drive are required to modify restrictions.
adminManagedRestrictions.title: Admin Managed Restrictions

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether options to copy, print, or download files inside the shared drive are disabled for readers and commenters.
copyRequiresWriterPermission.title: Copy Requires Writer Permission

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to the shared drive and its contents is restricted to users of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.
domainUsersOnly.title: Domain Users Only

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside the shared drive is restricted to its members.
driveMembersOnly.title: Drive Members Only

sharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermissio.description: If true, only users with the organizer role can share folders; if false, users with either the organizer or file organizer role can share folders.
sharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermissio.title: Sharing Folders Requires Organizer Permission

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. Always 'drive#driveList' for this response.
kind.title: Kind

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results. Omitted if there are no further pages.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Move File
tools.description: Tool to move a file from one folder to another in Google Drive. Use when you need to reorganize files by changing their parent folder(s).

add_parents.description: The ID of the parent folder to add the file to. Google Drive files can only have one parent folder.
add_parents.title: Add Parents

file_id.description: The ID of the file to move.
file_id.title: File Id

include_labels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response.
include_labels.title: Include Labels

include_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.
include_permissions_for_view.title: Include Permissions For View

keep_revision_forever.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive.
keep_revision_forever.title: Keep Revision Forever

ocr_language.description: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).
ocr_language.title: Ocr Language

remove_parents.description: A comma-separated list of parent folder IDs to remove the file from. Use this to specify the source folder.
remove_parents.title: Remove Parents

supports_all_drives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Set to true if moving files to or from a shared drive.
supports_all_drives.title: Supports All Drives

use_content_as_indexable_text.description: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text.
use_content_as_indexable_text.title: Use Content As Indexable Text

appProperties.description: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs private to the application.
appProperties.title: App Properties

capabilities.description: A set of capabilities describing the actions the current user can perform on the file.
capabilities.title: Capabilities

canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission.title: Can Change Copy Requires Writer Permission

canMoveChildrenOutOfDrive.title: Can Move Children Out Of Drive

canMoveChildrenOutOfTeamDrive.title: Can Move Children Out Of Team Drive

canMoveChildrenWithinTeamDrive.title: Can Move Children Within Team Drive

canMoveItemOutOfDrive.title: Can Move Item Out Of Drive

canMoveItemOutOfTeamDrive.title: Can Move Item Out Of Team Drive

canMoveItemWithinTeamDrive.title: Can Move Item Within Team Drive

contentHints.description: Additional information about the file, such as indexing text and a custom thumbnail.
contentHints.title: ContentHints

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether copy requires a user to have writer permission on the file.
copyRequiresWriterPermission.title: Copy Requires Writer Permission

createdTime.description: The time at which the file was created (RFC 3339 date-time).
createdTime.title: Created Time

description.description: A short description of the file.
description.title: Description

driveId.description: ID of the shared drive the file resides in. Present only for items in shared drives. May be null or absent in responses that do not include shared drive context.
driveId.title: Drive Id

explicitlyTrashed.description: Whether the file was explicitly trashed by the user, rather than by the system.
explicitlyTrashed.title: Explicitly Trashed

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs to specific MIME types. Present only for Google Docs types.
exportLinks.title: Export Links

fileExtension.description: The final component of the full file extension. Attempted first from the original file name, then from the MIME type.
fileExtension.title: File Extension

folderColorRgb.description: The color of the folder as an RGB hex string. Only applicable to folders.
folderColorRgb.title: Folder Color Rgb

fullFileExtension.description: The full file extension; extracted from the last '.' in the file name. May contain multiple parts and is not guaranteed to be safe or accurate.
fullFileExtension.title: Full File Extension

hasAugmentedPermissions.description: Whether there are permissions on the file that are not directly part of the file's ACL, such as those granted by shared drive membership.
hasAugmentedPermissions.title: Has Augmented Permissions

hasThumbnail.description: Whether the file has a thumbnail.
hasThumbnail.title: Has Thumbnail

headRevisionId.description: The ID of the file's head revision. Applicable to Google Docs types.
headRevisionId.title: Head Revision Id

iconLink.description: A static, unauthenticated link to the file's icon.
iconLink.title: Icon Link

id.description: The unique ID of the file.
id.title: Id

isAppAuthorized.description: Whether the file content is restricted to the authenticated app. True if the current user is an authenticated app and the file was created by or is restricted to that app.
isAppAuthorized.title: Is App Authorized

kind.description: Identifies the type of resource. Always 'drive#file' for a File resource.
kind.title: Kind

lastModifyingUser.description: The last user to modify the file.
lastModifyingUser.title: DriveUser

kind.description: Resource type. Always 'drive#user'.
kind.title: Kind

linkShareMetadata.description: Information on security updates related to link sharing.
linkShareMetadata.title: LinkShareMetadata

md5Checksum.description: The MD5 checksum of the file content. Present only for files with content stored in Drive; not present for Google Docs.
md5Checksum.title: Md5 Checksum

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file. Google Drive displays and converts some types; Google Docs types begin with 'application/vnd.google-apps.'.
mimeType.title: Mime Type

modifiedByMe.description: Whether the file has been modified by the current user.
modifiedByMe.title: Modified By Me

modifiedByMeTime.description: The last time the file was modified by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).
modifiedByMeTime.title: Modified By Me Time

modifiedTime.description: The last time the file was modified by anyone (RFC 3339 date-time).
modifiedTime.title: Modified Time

name.description: The name of the file (not necessarily unique).
name.title: Name

originalFilename.description: The original filename of the uploaded file if available.
originalFilename.title: Original Filename

ownedByMe.description: Whether the user owns the file.
ownedByMe.title: Owned By Me

owners.description: The user(s) who own the file. For files in shared drives, organizers and file organizers are considered owners.
owners.title: Owners

kind.description: Resource type. Always 'drive#user'.
kind.title: Kind

parents.description: The IDs of the parent folders which contain the file. If not specified, the file is placed in the user's My Drive root.
parents.title: Parents

permissionIds.description: List of permission IDs for users and groups on the file.
permissionIds.title: Permission Ids

permissions.description: The full list of permissions on the file.
permissions.title: Permissions

kind.description: Resource type. Always 'drive#permission'.
kind.title: Kind

role.description: The role.
role.title: Role

properties.description: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs visible to all apps.
properties.title: Properties

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by this file.
quotaBytesUsed.title: Quota Bytes Used

resourceKey.description: The resource key for accessing the file when link protection is enabled.
resourceKey.title: Resource Key

shared.description: Whether the file has been shared.
shared.title: Shared

sharedWithMeTime.description: The time at which the file was shared with the user (RFC 3339 date-time).
sharedWithMeTime.title: Shared With Me Time

sharingUser.description: The user who shared the file with the current user. Present only for shared files.
sharingUser.title: DriveUser

kind.description: Resource type. Always 'drive#user'.
kind.title: Kind

shortcutDetails.description: Shortcut-specific metadata. Present only if mimeType is 'application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut'.
shortcutDetails.title: ShortcutDetails

size.description: The size of the file's content in bytes. Present only for files with content stored in Drive; not present for Google Docs.
size.title: Size

spaces.description: The spaces which contain the file. Supported values include 'drive', 'appDataFolder', and 'photos'.
spaces.title: Spaces

starred.description: Whether the file has been starred by the user.
starred.title: Starred

teamDriveId.description: Deprecated alias of driveId retained for backward compatibility. May be present for files in shared drives.
teamDriveId.title: Team Drive Id

thumbnailLink.description: A short-lived link to the file's thumbnail. Only valid for a limited time and may require access via the 'Authorization' header.
thumbnailLink.title: Thumbnail Link

trashed.description: Whether the file has been trashed. True if the file is in the trash.
trashed.title: Trashed

trashedTime.description: The time that the item was trashed (RFC 3339 date-time). Present only if the file is trashed.
trashedTime.title: Trashed Time

trashingUser.description: The user who trashed the file. Present only if the file is trashed.
trashingUser.title: DriveUser

kind.description: Resource type. Always 'drive#user'.
kind.title: Kind

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number of the file.
version.title: Version

viewedByMe.description: Whether the file has been viewed by this user.
viewedByMe.title: Viewed By Me

viewedByMeTime.description: The time at which the file was last viewed by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).
viewedByMeTime.title: Viewed By Me Time

viewersCanCopyContent.description: Whether users with 'reader' or 'commenter' roles can copy the file's content. Deprecated; use 'copyRequiresWriterPermission' to control copying behavior.
viewersCanCopyContent.title: Viewers Can Copy Content

webContentLink.description: A link for downloading the content of the file. Present only for files with binary content stored in Drive; not present for Google Docs types.
webContentLink.title: Web Content Link

webViewLink.description: A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.
webViewLink.title: Web View Link

writersCanShare.description: Whether users with the writer role can share the file.
writersCanShare.title: Writers Can Share

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Export or download a file
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Exports Google Workspace files (max 10MB) to a specified format using `mime_type`, or downloads other file types; use `GOOGLEDRIVE_DOWNLOAD_FILE` instead.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file stored in Google Drive that you want to export or download.
file_id.title: File Id

mime_type.description: Target MIME type for exporting Google Workspace documents (e.g., Docs, Sheets) to a different format (e.g., PDF, DOCX). Omit for direct download of non-Workspace files or if no conversion is needed for Workspace files.
mime_type.title: MimeType

file.description: The exported or downloaded file represented as a FileDownloadable object (name, mimetype, s3url).
file.title: File

name.description: Name of the file
name.title: Name

s3url.description: S3 URL of the downloaded file.
s3url.title: S3Url

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Resumable Upload
tools.description: Tool to start and complete a Google Drive resumable upload session. Use when uploading large files that require resumable, chunked uploads.

chunkSize.description: Chunk size in bytes; must be a multiple of 256 KB.
chunkSize.title: Chunk Size

metadata.description: JSON metadata for the Drive File resource (e.g., {'name': 'photo.jpg', 'parents': ['folderId']}).
metadata.title: Metadata

ignoreDefaultVisibility.description: Bypass domain default visibility for the created file.
ignoreDefaultVisibility.title: Ignore Default Visibility

tools.description: Updates file metadata. Uses PATCH semantics (partial update) as per Google Drive API v3. Use this tool to modify attributes of an existing file like its name, description, or parent folders. Note: This action currently supports metadata updates only. File content updates require multipart/related upload and are not yet implemented.

tools.name: Update File Revision Metadata
tools.description: Updates metadata of a file revision (e.g., keepForever, publish). Use this tool to modify the metadata of a specific revision of a file in Google Drive.

keep_forever.description: Whether to keep this revision forever, even if it is no longer the head revision. If not set, the revision will be automatically purged 30 days after newer content is uploaded. This can be set on a maximum of 200 revisions for a file. This field is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.
keep_forever.title: Keep Forever

publishAuto.description: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.
publishAuto.title: Publish Auto

published.description: Whether this revision is published. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.
published.title: Published

publishedOutsideDomain.description: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.
publishedOutsideDomain.title: Published Outside Domain

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Docs Editors files to specific formats.
exportLinks.title: Export Links

id.description: The ID of the revision.

tools.name: Upload File
tools.description: Uploads a file (max 5MB) to Google Drive, moving it to a specified folder if a valid folder ID is provided, otherwise uploads to root.

file_to_upload.title: FileUploadable
file_to_upload.description: File to upload to Google Drive (max 5MB). Provide an object with 'name' (filename), 'mimetype' (content type), and 's3key' (pre-uploaded internal storage key from temp bucket). The s3key must reference a file already uploaded to internal S3/R2 storage; local file paths and URLs are not accepted.

folder_to_upload_to.description: Optional ID of the target Google Drive folder; can be obtained using 'Find Folder' or similar actions.
folder_to_upload_to.title: Folder To Upload To

appProperties.description: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app.

tools.name: Watch Drive Changes
tools.description: Tool to subscribe to changes for a user or shared drive in Google Drive. Use when you need to monitor a Google Drive for modifications and receive notifications at a specified webhook URL.

address.description: The URL where notifications are to be delivered.
address.title: Address

drive_id.description: The shared drive from which changes will be returned. If specified, change IDs will be specific to the shared drive.
drive_id.title: Drive Id

expiration.description: Timestamp in milliseconds since the epoch for when the channel should expire. If not set, channel may not expire or have a default expiration.
expiration.title: Expiration

id.description: A unique string that identifies this channel. UUIDs are recommended.
id.title: Id

include_corpus_removals.description: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes.
include_corpus_removals.title: Include Corpus Removals

include_items_from_all_drives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.
include_items_from_all_drives.title: Include Items From All Drives

include_labels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the labelInfo part of the response.
include_labels.title: Include Labels

include_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.
include_permissions_for_view.title: Include Permissions For View

include_removed.description: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes (e.g., by deletion or loss of access).
include_removed.title: Include Removed

page_size.description: The maximum number of changes to return per page.
page_size.title: Page Size

page_token.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.
page_token.title: Page Token

params.description:
Optional parameters for the notification channel.
Example: {"ttl": "3600"} for a 1-hour time-to-live (actual support depends on Google API).
params.title: ChannelParams

restrict_to_my_drive.description: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files like those in the Application Data folder or shared files not added to My Drive.
restrict_to_my_drive.title: Restrict To My Drive

spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpora. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.
spaces.title: Spaces

supports_all_drives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Recommended to set to true if driveId is used or if interactions with shared drives are expected.
supports_all_drives.title: Supports All Drives

token.description: An arbitrary string that will be delivered with each notification. Can be used for verification.
token.title: Token

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism for notifications (e.g., 'web_hook').
type.title: Type

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel. For 'web_hook' channels, this is the HTTPS endpoint URL that receives POST requests.
address.title: Address

expiration.description: Date and time when the notification channel expires, expressed as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds since the epoch (UTC).
expiration.title: Expiration

id.description: A unique identifier for this channel, returned in the watch response and echoed in notifications.
id.title: Id

kind.description: Identifies this as a notification channel resource. Always 'api#channel'.
kind.title: Kind

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. A map of string keys to string values.
params.title: Params

payload.description: Whether to include a resource payload with each notification. For 'web_hook' channels, true indicates that the POST body will contain information about the changed resource; otherwise, notifications contain only headers.
payload.title: Payload

resourceId.description: An opaque identifier for the specific resource being watched on this channel; set by the server and used to verify notifications.
resourceId.title: Resource Id

resourceUri.description: A version-specific identifier or canonical URL for the watched resource; set and returned by the server.
resourceUri.title: Resource Uri

token.description: An arbitrary string provided by the application that is delivered with each notification.
token.title: Token

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel. For Drive push notifications, the supported value is 'web_hook'.
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
